name: AwsCliLoop
description: Run an AWS CLI command in a loop, controlled by a separate command, and interacts with output
author: Gio Palacino
helpMarkDown: The AWS Command Line Interface (CLI) is a unified tool to manage your AWS services. With just one tool to download and configure, you can control multiple AWS services from the command line and automate them through scripts. You must have the AWS CLI installed to use this task. See http://docs.aws.amazon.com/cli/latest/userguide/installing.html for more details.

inputs.name: awsCredentials
inputs.label: AWS Credentials
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the AWS credentials to use when it executes on a build host. If needed, click on 'Manage', and add a new Service Endpoint of type 'AWS'.

inputs.name: regionName
inputs.label: AWS Region
inputs.helpMarkDown: The AWS region code (us-east-1, us-west-2 etc) of the region containing the AWS resource(s) the task will use or create. For more information see [AWS Regions and Endpoints](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/rande.html).

inputs.name: workingDirectory
inputs.label: Working Directory
inputs.helpMarkDown: The working directory within which to execute the commands.

inputs.name: awsCommand
inputs.label: Command
inputs.helpMarkDown: The AWS CLI command to run. Run `aws help` to get complete list of commands or refer to: https://docs.aws.amazon.com/cli/latest/userguide/command-structure.html.

inputs.name: awsSubCommand
inputs.label: Subcommand
inputs.helpMarkDown: The AWS CLI command to run. Run `aws help` to get complete list of commands or refer to: https://docs.aws.amazon.com/cli/latest/userguide/command-structure.html.

inputs.name: awsArguments
inputs.label: Options and parameters
inputs.helpMarkDown: The arguments to pass to the AWS CLI command. Run `aws <command> --help` to get complete list of arguments supported by the command.

inputs.name: regularExpression
inputs.label: Output Regular Expression
inputs.helpMarkDown: The regular expression to use for parsing the output into the named variable.

inputs.name: regExMatchIndex
inputs.label: Value Match Index
inputs.helpMarkDown: The regular expression matches starting index to use for the value.

inputs.name: awsLoopCommand
inputs.label: Command
inputs.helpMarkDown: The AWS CLI command to run. Run `aws help` to get complete list of commands or refer to: https://docs.aws.amazon.com/cli/latest/userguide/command-structure.html.

inputs.name: awsLoopSubCommand
inputs.label: Subcommand
inputs.helpMarkDown: The AWS CLI command to run. Run `aws help` to get complete list of commands or refer to: https://docs.aws.amazon.com/cli/latest/userguide/command-structure.html.

inputs.name: awsLoopArguments
inputs.label: Options and parameters
inputs.helpMarkDown: The arguments to pass to the AWS CLI command. Captured values from the primary command will be appended. Example: '--fleet-id' become '--fleet-id <captured_value>'

inputs.name: failOnStandardError
inputs.label: Fail on Standard Error
inputs.helpMarkDown: If this is true, this task will fail if any errors are written to the StandardError stream.

messages.AWSCLINotInstalled: AWS CLI is not installed on this machine.
